unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about seeing a neurologist in India, right? Well, if you're having recurring headaches or maybe some tingling in your limbs, it's probably a good idea to consult a neuro. In big cities like Mumbai, Delhi or Bangalore, you'll find plenty of options. AIIMS Delhi, for example, has a really good Neurology department. I’ve heard Dr. Rajesh Kumar there is quite good. But seriously, don't self-diagnose just based on Dr. Google!
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about seeing a neurologist in India, right? Well, if you are having recurring headaches or maybe some tingling in your limbs, it is probably a good idea to consult a neuro. In big cities like Mumbai, Delhi or Bangalore, you will find plenty of options. A-I-I-M-S Delhi, for example, has a really good Neurology department. I have heard Doctor Rajesh Kumar there is quite good. But seriously, don't self-diagnose just based on Doctor Google!

unnormalised: Now, what to expect? The first consult will probably involve a lot of questions about your med history, fam history (related to neuro issues, of course!) and a physical exam. They might order tests like an MRI or EEG. An MRI brain scan at a good hospital could cost you anywhere between Rs. 6000-10000, depending on where you go. The doc might prescribe meds or suggest physiotherapy.
normalised: Now, what to expect? The first consult will probably involve a lot of questions about your medical history, family history (related to neuro issues, of course!) and a physical exam. They might order tests like an M-R-I or E-E-G. An M-R-I brain scan at a good hospital could cost you anywhere between rupee six thousand to ten thousand, depending on where you go. The doc might prescribe meds or suggest physiotherapy.

unnormalised: For conditions like migraines, they might start you on something like Amitriptyline 25mg. For other conditions, the treatment is varied. Just remember to be open and honest with your doctor. Also, getting a second opinion is always a good idea.
normalised: For conditions like migraines, they might start you on something like Amitriptyline twenty five milligram. For other conditions, the treatment is varied. Just remember to be open and honest with your doctor. Also, getting a second opinion is always a good idea.

unnormalised: Ultimately, your health is what matters! So, don’t delay and visit a specialist. Find a good neurologist in your city and get yourself checked. You can also find top doctors online on portals like Practo or Apollo 24/7. Best of luck!
